# *Dyēus Dyēus Important God of PIE cultures

"daylight-sky-god" «most securely reconstructed deity of the Indo-European pantheon»

*di or dei- "to shine, be bright"

Endings: day 𒌓 dag₂ 𒌓𒌓 dadag "bright" 𐀳𐀃 te-o god deus deon θεόν theon 𓈍 Dawn 𓆓𓇳𓈖 = 旦 dàn dawn Tan@Turk 𒀭 DINGIR deor Thor thunder & lighting 𒀭 DINGIR deity

dayⁿ

Dayⁿ personification of the day տիւ tiw "bright day" 天 tiān 𐀪 don

𓈍 Dawn din ("break of the day") 𓆓𓇳𓈖 = 旦 dàn dawn Tan@Turk 𒀭 DINGIR 𓇼 #DWA Doan ⋍ Stern Stunden Duan 𓇽 Du’ort Dort 𓏏 𓇼 𓄿 𓇳 |dawn, morning| DAWN! 旦 dàn <> 𒀭 DINGIR 𓇼 𓄿 𓇳 djournéra ≈ Dorn ≈ dawn 𓆓 𓂝 𓈖 / 𓂝 𓈖 𓆓 𓇳 𓇯 𓈌 𒌓𒉌 UTU.NI to dawn; to do something at daybreak 𒌓𒁺 DU (sun)dawn 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | sunrise | dawn day طوغمه doğma طوغ doğ- “to be born” + مه -ma 𒌉 DUMU ≈ doğmak Tag <> do beget
